metadata.Title: CVE-2023-40745 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
LibTIFF is vulnerable to an integer overflow. This flaw allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possiblyexecute an arbitrary code via a crafted tiff image, which triggers aheap-based buffer overflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-40745` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.6-1ubuntu0.8+esm12
libtiff-tools - 4.0.6-1ubuntu0.8+esm12
libtiff5 - 4.0.6-1ubuntu0.8+esm12
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.6-1ubuntu0.8+esm12
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: tiff package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.6-1ubuntu0.8+esm12').
